colorLib
Class Palette

java.lang.Object
  colorLib.Palette
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClLoversTheme, ColrTheme, Gradient, KulerTheme, RandomPalette
public class Palette
extends java.lang.Object

Creates a Palette object which will hold all your colors.

Author:
Andreas Köberle, Jan Vantomme

Constructor Detail

Palette

public Palette(processing.core.PApplet i_p)
Creates a new palette object which holds your colors. All color manipulation is done over this object. By default it creates an empty palette with a placeholder for 10 colors. You can also pass an array of colors or an PImage object to create a new palette. If you pass a PImage, all duplicate colors will be deleted. At least you can use a given color shemer .cs file or an .act file which you can create in Photoshop for example.

Parameters:
i_p - PApplet, normally use 'this'

Palette

public Palette(processing.core.PApplet i_p,
               int i_length)
Creates a Palette with a certain length.

Parameters:
i_length - int: length of the created

               int[] i_colors)
Creates a Palette from an array of colors.

Parameters:
i_colors - color[]: an array of colors

Palette

public Palette(processing.core.PApplet i_p,
               processing.core.PImage i_image)
Creates a Palette from PImage object. Duplicate colors are removed from the Palette.

Parameters:
i_image - PImage:

Palette

public Palette(processing.core.PApplet i_p,
               processing.core.PImage i_image,
               int cnt)
Creates a Palette from PImage object. Duplicate colors are removed from the Palette.

Parameters:
cnt - int: the count of colors that will be extracted from the pic using the medain cut algorithm

               java.lang.String i_filename)
Creates a Palette object from a .cs or .act file located in the data folder of your sketch.

Parameters:
i_filename - String: The filename of the .cs or .act file you want to load.

makeTriad

public void makeTriad(int i_color,
                      int i_angle)
Creates a 3 color palette that makes up a triangle on the RYB color wheel. The default angle of the triangle is 120 degrees, for an equilateral triangle, but you can pass your own in the range of 0-180.

Parameters:
i_color -
i_angle -

sortByHue

public void sortByHue()
Sorts the Palette by hue starting with red end ends blue.

sortBySaturation

public void sortBySaturation()
Sorts the Palette by saturation with element at last index containing the most saturated item of the palette. This method based on toxi's colour code snippets.

sortByLuminance

public void sortByLuminance()
Sorts the Palette by luminance with element at last index containing the "brightest" item of the Palette.This method based on toxi's colour code snippets.

sortByProximity

Sorts the Palette by proximity to a colour with element at first index containing the "closest" item of the Palette.This method based on toxi's coloor code snippets.

i_color -

getNearestHues

public java.lang.String[] getNearestHues()
Returns an array with the nearest hue to the Palettes color as an array of the following strings: "red", "orange", "yellow", "lime", "green", "teal", "cyan", "azure", "blue", "indigo", "purple", "pink"
